name: proxtop
description: An experimental proxer.me desktop client for doing the most common things.

releases.name: v1.0.0 Beta Release
releases.body:
Version 1.0 of proxtop is coming, soon. This is a preview build and is probably still pretty buggy (but already somewhat usable).

The purpose of this build is to make sure issues get spotted before the actual 1.0 release lands. It is technically "feature complete" for 1.0, but again, probably still error prone. So as soon as you find something that is not working properly, could be enhanced or just looks fishy: please submit an issue, send me a mail or tell me somewhere else. I'd appreciate it.

### So what did change for the v1.0 release?

There are some quality of life changes, like automatically scrolling to the bottom of a conversation once new messages arrived. But the meat is basically the switch to the official API from Proxer.me. This means that (for most things) Proxtop won't have to rely on an ever changing website, but can use a fixed interface that is provided by proxer. So if the site changes visually, it would have no effect on proxtop*. This is mostly visible in the messaging area. Messaging works better now, is way more reponsive than before, saves messages locally to read them while offline and makes sure you get notified when a new one comes in.

There's only a small caveat. The API only allows for a certain number of requests per minute. You don't have to worry about it, but Proxtop will give you a small message when this happens. Once the limit is reached, Proxtop will have to wait until it can do requests again, so please be patient with it during that time :)

Well then, have fun with Proxtop and happy holidays!

Full changelog can be found as always in the [changelog](https://github.com/kumpelblase2/proxtop/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md) file. If you want to see the changes in detail, you can see all commits here: [history](https://github.com/kumpelblase2/proxtop/compare/v0.4.2...v1.0.0-beta)

\* Sadly, there are still some things that I can't use the API for. Hopefully, I can get rid of those parts too at some point.

releases.name: Version 0.4.2 - Bishoujo - Bugfix 2
releases.body:
Even though this looks like a small release, I've done some work in the background that will hopefully be available to you soon, namely auto updates. It isn't really compatible with how I did my versions up to this point so don't be scared if the format is a little different. Since that is one of the main reasons why I pushed this update, please bear  with me if there are not many other changes:

Additions:
- Added ability to disable automatic update checks

Fixes:
- Fix watchlist not refreshing after updating it in proxtop
- Fixed parsing of profiles which have never been updated
- Fixed parsing of empty watchlists
- Fix logout not working how it's supposed to

Auto-Updates are not available in this version, but will be starting from the next version. 

Full changelog can be found as always in the [changelog](https://github.com/kumpelblase2/proxtop/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md) file. If you want to see the changes in detail, you can see all commits here: [history](https://github.com/kumpelblase2/proxtop/compare/v0.4.1-alpha5...v0.4.2)

releases.name: Version 0.4.1 - Bishoujo - Bugfix 1
releases.body:
Oh man, I'm not getting much done :/ However, I do think it's a good time to do a bugfix release especially because the site changes just broke the application. That obviously got fixed but that's not all:

**Added better caching to the application**

This is not a replacement for the caching system that's already in place, because they have different reasons. The "old" is for making sure that even if the network is offline, proxtop will be able to display the last responses. For example when you close the app, went on a train ride and opened the app again, then that cache is going to kick in.

This new caching system is for reducing load on the site and making proxtop respond faster (with the cost of possibly not being 100% up to date). The cache currently - at least for me - is really passive. That means things are cached longer than you might want them to be cached, but I can improve on this in the future as this is just the first step into a nicer and better usability experience. The goal would be to directly display information and update it shortly after if there's something newer available.

This system only caches information that would get displayed, not actions that you do, so those are guaranteed to happen and will never get cached.

Full changelog can be found in the [changelog](https://github.com/kumpelblase2/proxtop/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md) file. If you want to see the changes in detail, you can see all commits here: [history](https://github.com/kumpelblase2/proxtop/compare/v0.4.0-alpha5...v0.4.1-alpha5)

releases.name: Version 0.4.0 - Bishoujo
releases.body:
So little time, so much to do :S Anyway, I really want to get this out, so here we go:

**Version 0.4.0 - Bishoujo!**

I updated the UI quite a bit but there's still some areas which will need an improvement (titlebar for example). Nevertheless, I think the new UI looks better in general, even if the material design theme is starting to be a bit overused these days (on the other hand I suck at UI so this is good enough for me). Also I want to provide proper linux packages from now on, given that it's my primary platform as well. That means Debian and Arch Linux will be the supported packages from me. Debian package will be in the releases, arch will obviously end up in the AUR (thus it will come a little later).

What I'm also really happy about is that you can now finally play anime episodes directly in any other media player. This was somewhat possible before, yet really complicated, so I'm happy that you can now just put in your favorite media player (that supports internet videos, such as VLC or MPV), select the episode from your watchlist and it will start. Sidenote here: this was the main reason I created proxtop :) .

Otherwise, favorites are now integrated into messages so you can keep up with the most important conversations. If you want, you can also hide any other conversations if you feel like it. Which most likely means that you wouldn't see a message from me, if I write you one :( . Anyway, I also added the actions you have on the site in addition to favorite, so block and report. Since I don't have a reason to report anyone nor do I want to create useless work for anyway, reporting might not work as well as you'd expect. However, it would be great if you could then tell me if something is off.

Some things under the hood have changed as well, such as an improved handling of the tray icon (windows 7) and updates to frameworks and dependencies. Nothing spectacular, but still worth mentioning.

If you have any problems, wishes or improvements please send them my way. I'd greatly appreciate it! Have fun! ~

Full changelog can be found in the [changelog](https://github.com/kumpelblase2/proxtop/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md) file. If you want to see the changes in detail, you can see all commits here: [history](https://github.com/kumpelblase2/proxtop/compare/v0.3.1-alpha4...v0.4.0-alpha5)

For Arch Linux packages, please go over to my [pkgbuilds](https://github.com/kumpelblase2/pkgbuilds) repository, where you can find the build files for stable and git packages.

releases.name: Version 0.3.1 - Nikki - Bugfix 1
releases.body:
This is a small bugfix release to fix some issues that were not handled properly in the latest version.
- Automatically save settings
- Fix display issue if avatar is too large in height.
- Fix too many tray icons on windows 7.
- Fix error when proxer displays to reload the site.
- Fix duplicate messages when opening a new conference.

Full changelog can be found in the [changelog](https://github.com/kumpelblase2/proxtop/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md) file. If you want to see the changes in detail, you can see all commits here: [history](https://github.com/kumpelblase2/proxtop/compare/v0.3.0-alpha4...7c4a105644091944d3ba42940b7a6f72c6fec431)

releases.name: Version 0.3.0 - Nikki
releases.body:
After doing the last polishes last night, here we are finally with the next release! ~

Presenting the third release of Proxtop, Nikki! In addition to a nice icon, there have been made almost 80 changes in the past weeks, so what are you getting out of it?

The focus here was to get messaging to a usable state as it was severely lacking so far. You can now write properly write messages, load older ones and even get notified when you receive one. Notifications here work the same as they do for watchlist updates, so they're not instant but get checked in a certain interval. We'll have to wait for the proxer team to implement something that would allow for live updates, as I don't want to overload their site.

There have also been some internal improvements to further stabilize the app and also have updated dependencies. You don't want to run on year old technologies, do you? This included some bug fixes for you too, obviously. One of those is that notifications now also work on older Windows versions (7/8/8.1) in the form of balloons. This might change in the future to have a consistent user experience across platforms, but for the time being this does the job. Speaking of user experience, there were some instances where the UI looked inconsistent or could behave better. I have fixed some instances that I came accross, but if you find other places where things could look/work better, feel free to let me know.

**IMPORTANT:** There is another change that I have done internally that you should be aware about. By default, Proxtop now uses a custom User-Agent header. What is it and why should you care? A User-Agent is metadata that gets sent over to the site every time you access it (your browser does the same). It contains info about what you're using to access the site, such as OS and the application + version. This information could then be used to treat specific users differently, if the site owners so desire. If you don't want that Proxtop sends such identifiable information, you can go into the settings and turn on "Universal User-Agent" to mimic a generic user agent and thus not stand out from anyone else. I don't think this will be an issue at all, given what I know about the people at proxer, but I want to be fully transparent about these changes. 

Now that we got that out of the way, I hope you have a lot of fun using Proxtop and are looking forward to more improvements!

Full changelog can be found in the [changelog](https://github.com/kumpelblase2/proxtop/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md) file. If you want to see the changes in detail, you can see all commits here: [history](https://github.com/kumpelblase2/proxtop/compare/v0.2.1-alpha3...d0b32ac934a07db7302ac7816fe0f2fab79cf2d2)

releases.name: Verison 0.2.1 - Shinki - Bugfix 1
releases.body:
This is just a quick bugfix release to fix an error with non-existent settings. Since this is severe, it has its own release. 

Old release notes here:

I'm happy to present the second release of Proxtop, 0.2.0 "Shinki"!

So what's new?

This update was mostly focused around improving the watching experience. In addition to supporting more streams, you can now chose from the available ones and have the same actions as on the web page available for you. So you can now update your watchlist and go to the next or previous episode. This is bundled with some other UI fixes on the main page and other improvements, to make things a bit more snappy. One of these is a small updating notification, that will notify you, once a new version is available and I'm planing to improve this mechanism over the next releases.

I hope you enjoy it!

Full changelog can be found in the [changelog](https://github.com/kumpelblase2/proxtop/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md) file. If you want to see the changes in detail, you can see all commits here: [history](https://github.com/kumpelblase2/proxtop/compare/v0.1.1-alpha2...113bc3c46ddd29e38d6e330c532a4c8cfca03fcf)

releases.name: Verison 0.2.0 - Shinki
releases.body:
I'm happy to present the second release of Proxtop, 0.2.0 "Shinki"!

So what's new?

This update was mostly focused around improving the watching experience. In addition to supporting more streams, you can now chose from the available ones and have the same actions as on the web page available for you. So you can now update your watchlist and go to the next or previous episode. This is bundled with some other UI fixes on the main page and other improvements, to make things a bit more snappy. One of these is a small updating notification, that will notify you, once a new version is available and I'm planing to improve this mechanism over the next releases.

I hope you enjoy it!

Full changelog can be found in the [changelog](https://github.com/kumpelblase2/proxtop/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md) file. If you want to see the changes in detail, you can see all commits here: [history](https://github.com/kumpelblase2/proxtop/compare/v0.1.1-alpha2...113bc3c46ddd29e38d6e330c532a4c8cfca03fcf)

releases.name: Initial Alpha release
releases.body:
Now that this is somewhat usable I think I can mark this as the first alpha release. Many things missing, bugs all over the place, but at least not directly crashing which is good enough for now.

Things that are currently available:
- Login, view profile status and look at recent news (can also open news in browser)
- View messages
- Display watchlist and get notifications upon watched uploads
- Watch animes from watchlist directly in the app or pipe video to another application

For FAQ please refer to the README.

I have made sure that the app will at least _run_ on all platforms, but I cannot guarantee that there are no platform specific issues. But if you find anything in that area, feel free to report it, I have all platforms at my disposal so should be able to debug platform specific issues.

Also feel free to create an issue if you have a question, feature suggestion, bug report or want to bring something else to my attention, I'll try my best to respond and help out.

Last but not least, Have fun!

Side note: I marked this _not_ as a pre-release because even though it's meant to be a preview, I want to make sure that people are aware that they can use this for now.

releases.name: First testing release.
releases.body: This is pretty much just a testing release to check if building for other platforms works.
